casebody.data:
STATE
v.
Quintel Martinez AUGUSTINE 130A03-2 Supreme Court of North Carolina. July 13, 2018 Gretchen Engel, Attorney at Law, Durham, James E. Ferguson, II, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, for Augustine, Quintel Martinez. Danielle Marquis Elder, Special Deputy Attorney General, Jonathan P. Babb, Special Counsel to Attorney General, William R. West, District Attorney, for State of N.C. Grady Jessup, Attorney at Law, for N.C. Association of Black Lawyers. Lisa A. Bakale-Wise, Attorney at Law, Irving Joyner, Attorney at Law, Durham, for N.C. State Conference of the NAACP. Edward Joseph Blocher, Jr., Attorney at Law, for Social Scientists. Janet Moore, Attorney at Law, for National Association for Public Defense. Robert P. Mosteller, Attorney at Law, for Professors John Charles Boger & Robert P. Mosteller.

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 12th of July 2018 by National Association for Public Defender for leave to file Amicus Curiae Brief:

*365"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 13th of July 2018."
